thread.title: NY girl, 12, dies from bullet fired into house; police plead for help to ID shooter
thread.title_full: NY girl, 12, dies from bullet fired into house; police plead for help to ID shooter | OregonLive.com

author: Associated Press
title: NY girl, 12, dies from bullet fired into house; police plead for help to ID shooter
text:
HEMPSTEAD, N.Y.â€” A 12-year-old girl who was hit in the head by a bullet fired from outside her Long Island home has died, Nassau County authorities said Sunday.
Dejah Joyner was pronounced dead at Winthrop Hospital in Mineola on Saturday night, police said.
She was inside her living room in Hempstead on Friday evening when someone opened fire outside , investigators said. One of the bullets went through a plate-glass window and hit her.
Police are investigating the possibility of a stray bullet from a gang-related incident near the home, WCBS-TV in New York reported .
Acting Nassau County District Attorney Madeline Singas asked anyone with information to come forward to investigators.
"We cannot sit idly by as 12-year-old children are gunned down in their own living rooms," Acting Nassau District Attorney Madeline Singas said. "This person...will pay for what he did to that 12-year-old."
Local officials and religious leaders gathered Sunday afternoon to share their sympathy for the family and outrage over the shooting, Newsday reported.
"My heart is broken, my heart goes out to the family," Hempstead Village Mayor Wayne Hall said at Antioch Baptist Church. "I'm really sick and tired of being sick and tired."
The Hempstead Board of Education said grief counselors would be available at Hempstead Middle School for students on Monday.
Authorities are offering a reward of up to $75,000 for information leading to an arrest in the shooting. Anyone with information is asked to call 1-800-244-TIPS (8477).
